cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 275 mi SSW of Nantucket, Massachusetts and 650 mi SW of Halifax, Nova Scotia
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward, on track to cross over/east of Nova Scotia then toward Newfoundland and the Gulf of St. Lawrence

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch – Southwestern Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, Magdalen Islands, Southwestern Newfoundland; Tropical-Storm Watch – Fundy National Park to Shediac NB, parts of Newfoundland coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning – Eastern Nova Scotia Hubbards to Avonport; Tropical-Storm Warning – Woods Hole MA to Eastport ME, Nantucket & Martha’s Vineyard, Prince Edward Island, Southwestern Nova Scotia
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern New England, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, Gulf of St. Lawrence and Newfoundland coasts
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected; only breezy northerly flow in wake of Dorian.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Savannah – coastal water levels returning to normal.
weather_observation.rainfall: No additional heavy rainfall expected; only scattered showers possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Residual long-period swells and rip currents along the Georgia coast through the next 24 h may affect small-craft operations.
